Events
Events in St. Augustine | Ponte Vedra run the gamut.
Editor's Note: Please call to confirm before driving long distances as some times and details may vary.
From foodie festivals to golf tournaments to
reenactments
of events from our history and, of course, the holiday spectacular
Nights of Lights
.
EVENTS & FESTIVALS
Each spring,
Florida’s Photo Fest
brings nature lovers and photographers together to study the area’s native wildlife through bird walks, kayak tours and photography workshops. Also in spring, golf fans gather to watch legends tee off during
THE PLAYERS Championship
at TPC Sawgrass in Ponte Vedra Beach.
Downtown St. Augustine lights up on the Fourth of July, when
Fireworks Over The Matanzas
draws everyone’s eyes to the skies over Matanzas Bay. From mid-November through January you can see 3 million white lights illuminate St. Augustine’s historic district during
Nights of Lights
.
And that’s just the beginning. Use our Events Calendar below to see what’s going on during your stay.

About Us
St. Augustine, Ponte Vedra & The Beaches VCB
Welcome to the Official Industry Partners Website of St. Augustine, Ponte Vedra & The Beaches Visitors and Convention Bureau.
WHAT WE DO
St. Augustine, Ponte Vedra & The Beaches
The mission of the St. Johns County Visitors and Convention Bureau (VCB) also known as St. Augustine, Ponte Vedra & The Beaches, is to brand and market the destination globally as a world-class leisure, convention and business destination; to communicate the area’s assets and inherent benefits to consumers, meeting planners, travel trade, media, local community and constituents; and to facilitate the opportunity for partners to promote their individual businesses within that framework

Major Holidays
Christmas
Nights of Lights
Christmas on Florida’s Historic Coast
Make your Christmas merry and bright with special events to celebrate the season.
The Christmas season in St. Augustine is known for its sensational
Nights of Lights
holiday display. During Nights of Lights, white lights glow from the sidewalks to the rooftops, over the
Bridge of Lions
and trail through approximately 20 city blocks in
St. Augustine’s Historic District
. Taking in the soft, magical glow of more than 3 million white lights is an unforgettable experience – which is why it’s considered one of the top light displays in the world.
Special events taking place during the
holiday season
will be added as information becomes available.
More Merry & Bright Things to Do!

Home
Events
Annual Events
Ponte Vedra Auto Show
Ponte Vedra Auto Show
November 2, 2025
See Northeast Florida’s best classic and exotic cars at this popular annual event in upscale Ponte Vedra Beach.
The 22nd Anniversary edition of this extremely popular auto show takes place from 10 a.m. – 3 p.m. at Nocatee Station Field, 245 Nocatee Center Way in
Ponte Vedra Beach
.
Two hundred classic and collector cars will be on display and in competition for special honors in 25 categories from 10 a.m.-3 p.m. Admission and parking are free. A variety of local food trucks as well quality product vendors will be in attendance.
www.pvautoshow.com
The 2025 Ponte Vedra Auto Show is presented by O'Steen Automotive Group in association with Art n' Motion, the St. Johns County Chamber of Commerce and Nocatee.

10th Annual Jimmy Jam BBQ Slam
January 10, 2026 at the St. Johns County Fairgrounds
Outstanding BBQ competition, classic cars, cornhole championships, live music, arts and crafts – this event has it all!
What a great way to kick off the New Year—enjoy award-winning BBQ, feast your eyes on some classic cars and enjoy live music all day long. And while you’re having fun with friends and family, every dollar raised goes to meet the needs of local people who deserve a helping hand. It’s no wonder The Jimmy Jam BBQ Slam is one of the most popular events in the area.
Welcome to the Biggest BBQ Competition in North Florida, endorsed by the Kansas City BBQ Society
Enjoy the great lineup of events: KCBS Competition, Car Show, Cornhole Competition, BBQ Tastings, Paul Bunyan Lumberjack Show, Live Music, Over 50 Local Vendors, Ninja Nation Obstacle Course, Kids Zone, Food Trucks, Cold Beer and Drinks, Raffle and Chili Cookoff.
People’s Choice:
Free to enter, participants prepare People’s Choice entry meats prior to arrival at the contest. Entries will be served from 2-4 p.m. The big winner receives $2,000, plus a trophy. (Cash awards based on number of entries and cash awards to places second thru fifth as well.)
Enjoy the savory competition for
Best Chicken Wings, Best Slider, Bloody Mary, Margarita, Best BBQ Sauce and the Kid’s Pork Loin Competition
with trophies, ribbons and cash prizes—over $19,000 in payouts, based on number of entries! Award Ceremony at 5 p.m.
Cornhole and Vendors
Cornhole Competition:
Registration begins at 10 a.m. ($25 per person, blind draw) and the tournament starts promptly at 11 a.m.
In addition to the cooking and cornhole competitions,
more than 50 arts and crafts and food vendors will be featured throughout the event
.
Car Show
Categories include Classic, Truck and Motorcycle. Trophies awarded in each category. Entry fee is $20 ($25 day of show).
Entry Details
For entry forms and full details on the cooking, cornhole and car show events, please go to:
www.jimmyjambbqslam.com
Admission to the Jimmy Jam BBQ Slam is $15 per person (free for ages 10 and under) FREE parking. Gates open at 10 a.m.
The St. Johns County Fairgrounds are located at 5840 SR 207, in Elkton, FL

Ponte Vedra Beach Secrets and Things to Do
Most visitors only skim the surface of this high-end coastal resort town. Learn some fun facts about Ponte Vedra Beach and get great vacation ideas along the way.
A sophisticated city on Florida’s northeast coast,
Ponte Vedra
is synonymous with luxury. You can indulge at upscale
resorts
, perfect your tan on picturesque
beaches
or hit the links at world-class
golf courses
. But look closer and you’ll discover that this seaside community holds even more allure – including a rich, little-known history and diverse
activities
that will take you beyond its coastline. On your next vacation, discover these five secrets of Ponte Vedra.
Expand List
Ponte Vedra Vacation Ideas

Ponte Vedra Beach
.card__head
Ponte Vedra Beach
Get Directions
There’s a reason Ponte Vedra Beach made CNN’s list of 22 Can’t Miss U.S. Beaches.
.card__main
Learn More
.card__actions
.card__body
.card__inner
.card
#1: Hidden Gems (Literally)
Now a prominent resort town, Ponte Vedra was little more than pristine wilderness in the early 1900s. But valuable minerals were discovered in 1912, transforming the site into a frontier mining town called “Mineral City.”
Mining eventually gave way to resort life, and the
Ponte Vedra Inn & Club
sprung up in 1928. The wealthy elite flocked to this stylish oceanfront playground, which today is one of Florida’s rare AAA Five Diamond Properties. At the resort, pamper yourself at the
spa
or play a round of
golf
. To this day, the resort maintains a “quiet opulence” that is difficult to find at many resorts, making it a true retreat for guests.
Pictured
Ponte Vedra Inn, a stylish oceanfront playground
#2: Natural Wonders
Discover Florida at its natural best while exploring 73,000 protected acres of forests, tidal lagoons and coastal dunes at Guana Tolomato Matanzas National Estuarine Research Reserve (
GTM Reserve
).
You can kayak through saltwater marsh and mangrove tidal wetlands to witness the abundance of wildlife – 44 mammal, 358 bird and 580 plant species – at what Folio Weekly called the “Best Place to Kayak.” At low tide, hunt for seashells along the shore and keep an eye out for
sharks teeth
– the area is well-known for this. Explore 10 miles of hiking trails before visiting the Environmental Education Center, which features interactive displays and aquariums.
#3: A Hole in $1
If golf is your forte, tee off at
TPC Sawgrass
, one of the world’s most famous golf courses. This is where Tiger Woods’ “Better Than Most” putt was heard ‘round the world in 2001.
Opened in 1980, the mega-golf resort is the headquarters for the PGA Tour. Interestingly, the 415 acres that became TPC was sold to the Tour for just $1.
In March, watch the biggest names in golf compete in
THE PLAYERS Championship
, which boasts the largest purse on the tour. Then it’s your turn with the clubs. Take a swing at one of two championship courses designed by master architect Pete Dye.
#4: A Historic Landing
Did you know that
Ponce de Leon
first set foot on Florida just south of Ponte Vedra Beach? According to navigational records, the famous explorer came ashore at 30 degrees, 8 minutes north latitude and claimed “La Florida” for Spain on April 3, 1513. View the spot where he reportedly arrived from the GTM Reserve parking area and snap a pic with the bronze statue marking the location.
Afterward, visit
Ponte Vedra Beach
, where towering sand dunes lead to immaculate beaches. CNN named it one of “22 Can’t-Miss Beaches.”
Pictured
Ponte Vedra Beach
#5: Big-Name Concerts
For an unforgettable evening, listen to celebrated artists from across the world perform at the intimate new
Ponte Vedra Concert Hall
. This modern performing arts facility, housed in a former church building in Ponte Vedra Beach, features top-notch acoustics. Past performers include Lucinda Williams, Matisyahu, Art Garfunkel, the Goo Goo Dolls, Shawn Colvin, Roger McGuinn, Gillian Welch, Ani DiFranco and Shovels & Rope.
At the hall, you also can catch an array of other events, from film series like the WJCT 3X5 Classic Film Festival to classical music performances by the Florida Chamber Music Project.

Ponte Vedra Beach Secrets and Things to Do
Most visitors only skim the surface of this high-end coastal resort town. Learn some fun facts about Ponte Vedra Beach and get great vacation ideas along the way.
A sophisticated city on Florida’s northeast coast,
Ponte Vedra
is synonymous with luxury. You can indulge at upscale
resorts
, perfect your tan on picturesque
beaches
or hit the links at world-class
golf courses
. But look closer and you’ll discover that this seaside community holds even more allure – including a rich, little-known history and diverse
activities
that will take you beyond its coastline. On your next vacation, discover these five secrets of Ponte Vedra.
Expand List

Ponte Vedra Beach
.card__head
Ponte Vedra Beach
Get Directions
There’s a reason Ponte Vedra Beach made CNN’s list of 22 Can’t Miss U.S. Beaches.
.card__main
Learn More
.card__actions
.card__body
.card__inner
.card
#1: Hidden Gems (Literally)
Now a prominent resort town, Ponte Vedra was little more than pristine wilderness in the early 1900s. But valuable minerals were discovered in 1912, transforming the site into a frontier mining town called “Mineral City.”
Mining eventually gave way to resort life, and the
Ponte Vedra Inn & Club
sprung up in 1928. The wealthy elite flocked to this stylish oceanfront playground, which today is one of Florida’s rare AAA Five Diamond Properties. At the resort, pamper yourself at the
spa
or play a round of
golf
. To this day, the resort maintains a “quiet opulence” that is difficult to find at many resorts, making it a true retreat for guests.
Pictured
Ponte Vedra Inn, a stylish oceanfront playground
#2: Natural Wonders
Discover Florida at its natural best while exploring 73,000 protected acres of forests, tidal lagoons and coastal dunes at Guana Tolomato Matanzas National Estuarine Research Reserve (
GTM Reserve
).
You can kayak through saltwater marsh and mangrove tidal wetlands to witness the abundance of wildlife – 44 mammal, 358 bird and 580 plant species – at what Folio Weekly called the “Best Place to Kayak.” At low tide, hunt for seashells along the shore and keep an eye out for
sharks teeth
– the area is well-known for this. Explore 10 miles of hiking trails before visiting the Environmental Education Center, which features interactive displays and aquariums.
#3: A Hole in $1
If golf is your forte, tee off at
TPC Sawgrass
, one of the world’s most famous golf courses. This is where Tiger Woods’ “Better Than Most” putt was heard ‘round the world in 2001.
Opened in 1980, the mega-golf resort is the headquarters for the PGA Tour. Interestingly, the 415 acres that became TPC was sold to the Tour for just $1.
In March, watch the biggest names in golf compete in
THE PLAYERS Championship
, which boasts the largest purse on the tour. Then it’s your turn with the clubs. Take a swing at one of two championship courses designed by master architect Pete Dye.
#4: A Historic Landing
Did you know that
Ponce de Leon
first set foot on Florida just south of Ponte Vedra Beach? According to navigational records, the famous explorer came ashore at 30 degrees, 8 minutes north latitude and claimed “La Florida” for Spain on April 3, 1513. View the spot where he reportedly arrived from the GTM Reserve parking area and snap a pic with the bronze statue marking the location.
Afterward, visit
Ponte Vedra Beach
, where towering sand dunes lead to immaculate beaches. CNN named it one of “22 Can’t-Miss Beaches.”
Pictured
Ponte Vedra Beach
#5: Big-Name Concerts
For an unforgettable evening, listen to celebrated artists from across the world perform at the intimate new
Ponte Vedra Concert Hall
. This modern performing arts facility, housed in a former church building in Ponte Vedra Beach, features top-notch acoustics. Past performers include Lucinda Williams, Matisyahu, Art Garfunkel, the Goo Goo Dolls, Shawn Colvin, Roger McGuinn, Gillian Welch, Ani DiFranco and Shovels & Rope.
At the hall, you also can catch an array of other events, from film series like the WJCT 3X5 Classic Film Festival to classical music performances by the Florida Chamber Music Project.

Home
Events
Annual Events
Florida Skimboarding Pro/Am Tournament
Florida Skimboarding Pro/​Am Tournament
August 22–24, 2025
Every August on Vilano Beach, the Florida Skimboarding Pro/​Am Tournament draws athletes from around the world to showcase their skills and compete for top titles in this thrilling sport.
What’s skimboarding anyway?
Run, drop, slide. Nothing to it, right? Wrong! Skimboarding is an athletic sport that requires skill, speed and fearless competitiveness. That’s why athletes and amateurs from more than 75 beaches throughout Florida, the USA and the world come to this premier Pro/Am event to compete for the top titles in the sport.
Watch them as they defy gravity, spin mid-air and maneuver their skim boards over crashing waves. Whether you’re a spectator or a competitor looking to earn bragging rights, you’ll agree there’s no more thrilling way to spend a weekend at the beach and make lasting memories.
Where it’s at.
Join us at the
Vilano Beach
ramp. Come early, stay all day. The tournament takes place both days as athletes display their rad skills. Admission is free for spectators. Please note there is currently no on beach parking allowed at Vilano Beach.
Want to Compete?
The
Florida Skimboarding Pro/Am Tournament
is the only competition that allows riders two chances to advance before being eliminated. There are categories for all ages and skill levels.
What’s in the area?
On the Vilano Beach Pier, say hello and take a selfie with the Bird of Happiness. Then you’ll want to stop by the
Vilano Beach Artisan Market Walk
on Vilano Road open from 4-8 p.m. on Saturday. Local artisan-made items and more on display for sale. Free parking and admission.
If you’re hankering for some seafood, there’s no better spot than Vilano Beach for the freshest sea-to-table cuisine. Try
Aunt Kate’s on the River
and
Cap’s on the Water
offer stunning views of the Intracoastal Waterway to complement their fresh catch menus.
At sunset, you might want to cap off the day with a refreshing cocktail at the
Pesca Vilano
Rooftop Bar in the
Hyatt Place Vilano Beach
. The view is as spectacular as the day you’ve just had.
